Package gov.nih.nlm.ling.util

Class ParseTreeUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.util.ParseTreeUtils
  • public class ParseTreeUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of utility methods for manipulating parse trees.
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

    • Method Detail

      • matchPattern

        public static java.util.List<edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree> matchPattern​(edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree root,
                                                                       java.lang.String pattern)
        Matches a given tregex pattern with a parse tree.
        Parameters:
        root - the top node of the parse tree
        pattern - the tregex pattern
        Returns:
        list of subtrees that match the pattern, empty list if no match is found

      • matchNamedNodes

        public static java.util.List<ParseTreeUtils.NameTreePair> matchNamedNodes​(edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree root,
                                                                          java.lang.String pattern,
                                                                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> namedNodes)
        Matches a given tregex pattern with a parse tree and extracts the nodes corresponding to a named tregex node.
        Parameters:
        root - the top node of the parse tree
        pattern - the tregex pattern
        namedNodes - the list of tregex nodes to extract for each matching subtree
        Returns:
        list of named subtrees

      • getCorrespondingSubTree

        public static edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree getCorrespondingSubTree​(edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree root,
                                                                  SurfaceElement surf)
        Given the corresponding parse tree, finds the subtree associated with a textual unit.

        If the textual unit is gapped, it will find the subtree associated with the first part of the textual unit.

        Parameters:
        root - the parse tree
        surf - the textual unit
        Returns:
        the subtree corresponding with the textual unit, null if no subtree is found

      • getWordsFromTree

        public static java.util.List<Word> getWordsFromTree​(edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree tree,
                                                    Sentence sentence,
                                                    int firstOffset)
        Gets the list of words corresponding to a given tree.
        Parameters:
        tree - the tree
        sentence - the sentence corresponding to the tree
        firstOffset - the first character offset of the tree
        Returns:
        the list of words corresponding to the tree, empty list if no match can be found

      • getSpanFromTree

        public static Span getSpanFromTree​(edu.stanford.nlp.trees.Tree tree,
                                   Sentence sentence,
                                   int firstOffset)
        Gets the span of the yield of a tree.
        Parameters:
        tree - the tree corresponding to the span
        sentence - the sentence corresponding to the span
        firstOffset - the first character offset to look for the tree
        Returns:
        the span corresponding to the tree

      • findHeadListFromTree

        public static java.util.List<Word> findHeadListFromTree​(Sentence sentence,
                                                        java.util.List<Word> words)
        Given a word list, finds the heads associated with it.

        Currently, it uses a modified version of ModCollinsHeadFinder.

        Parameters:
        sentence - the sentence the words belong to
        words - a word list
        Returns:
        the head words

      • findHeadFromTree

        public static Word findHeadFromTree​(Sentence sentence,
                                    java.util.List<Word> words)
        Same as findHeadListFromTree(Sentence, List), but this method will return a single word as head.

        If more than one head is found with findHeadList(), this method will return the head that appears the last in text.

        Parameters:
        sentence - the sentence that the words belong to
        words - the list of words for which the head is sought
        Returns:
        the word that is head of the list of words
